p: Standardization defined as the normalization of a sample that can have a minimal amount of one or more compounds is yet another setback [ 9]. Unfortunately, phytotherapy rarely satisfies the standardization norms [ 32, 34]. This is mainly due to the lack of information about pharmacologically active compounds, and to the plants not being grown in a controlled environment [ 32, 34]. The variability of the content and concentration of constituents in a plant, together with the various extraction and processing techniques used by different manufacturers, lead to variability in the content and quality of marketed PBM [ 23, 29, 32, 34]. The consistency in composition and biological activity are prerequisites for the safe and effective use of therapeutic products [ 23, 32].
